sect1.title: Preparation
sect1.para: This section describes the preparatory steps that must be taken before the actual installation of &sls;. The installation procedure depends on the system used. See the following documentation:

listitem.para: For IBM &powerlinux; servers with IBM &powerkvm; using Kimchi, see .

sect1.para: If &slsreg; needs to be installed on a number of systems or partitions, it is recommended you create a network installation source. The same source can also be used for the concurrent installation on several partitions or several systems. The configuration of a network installation source is described in .
The installation can be controlled with a VNC client. For more information about VNC, see .
To participate in the linuxppc-dev mailing list, register using the forms at . The following links are pertinent to the maintenance of an installation:

listitem.para: is an effective help tool for assisting customers in solving problems. A corresponding article is published whenever &suse; discover that a special case could lead to serious problems. Search the portal using keywords like &power; or &powerkvm;.
Find security alerts at . &suse; also maintains two security-related mailing lists to which anyone may subscribe.
suse-security — General discussion of security regarding Linux and &suse;. All security alerts for &sls; are sent to this list.
suse-security-announce — The &suse; mailing list exclusively for security alerts.

sect2.para: Alternatively, use the virt-install command line tool, if you need to install multiple virtual machines on IBM &powerlinux; Server systems. virt-install allows many installation scenarios; in the following a remote installation scenario via VNC and PXE boot is outlined. For more information about virt-install, see .
